projects.title: Projects
projects.p1_desc: PowerApps + SharePoint app that allows each employee to access only the protocols assigned to their role and department.
projects.p1_why: This project was one of my first experiences with a real-world environment. I had to understand user needs, internal workflows and platform limitations. The most valuable part was learning to integrate different tools into a coherent flow that automates tasks and reduces manual errors. It was my first real step into the idea of a 'complete solution'.
projects.p2_desc: Fictional product catalog with full CRUD: add, update, delete, filter and sort products across multiple screens.
projects.p2_why: This project helped me understand how to structure, manage and manipulate data within a desktop application. It was an exercise that taught me to plan screens, maintain data consistency and apply basic architecture principles.
projects.p3_desc: Kotlin Android app that consumes the Pokémon API to display relevant Pokémon information.
projects.p3_why: Here I learned to work with real APIs and JSON trees. Beyond the playful theme, I learned how client-server communication works and how to present dynamic data efficiently in Android.

about.title: About me
about.body: I’m a developer trained in DAM with hands-on specialization in Salesforce (APEX 2025). I build clean, fast solutions—from WordPress sites to time-saving automations. I’m seeking my first junior role to deliver real impact while learning fast.
